JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The applicant was granted leave to represent himself and to use the NORP language in the proceedings before ORG Rule CARDINAL § § DATE ( a ) ) . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented successively by their Agent , Mr Răzvan - Horaţiu Radu , and their co - Agent , PERSON , of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE a committee of CARDINAL judges of the ORG decided , pursuant to LAW ( a ) of the LAW , to strike the application out of the ORG ’s list of cases in accordance with LAW ( a ) of the LAW . On DATE , following a request received from the applicant , the same committee decided to restore the application to the ORG ’s list of cases by virtue of LAW .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . By a prosecutor ’s order of DATE the applicant was detained at the ORG pending trial on murder charges .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG convicted the applicant of murder and sentenced him to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment on the basis of forensic , documentary and testimonial evidence , including the testimony of GPE and GPE
CARDINAL . The applicant remains in detention to date .

CARDINAL . DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s medical condition was reviewed regularly by prison and civil hospitals and he received treatment for , inter alia , an antisocial personality disorder , epilepsy , syphilis , scabies , repeated headaches , diabetes , stomatological problems , hernia , obstructive chronic bronchitis , tuberculosis , arterial hypertension , varicose veins in his feet , chronic gastritis , and an old fracture of the left tibia following a gunshot wound received before DATE . It was recommended that he follow a diet for the chronic gastritis and diabetes , and avoid cold , damp and infections , and extended orthostatism . None of the medical reports produced during this period mentioned any injuries on the applicant ’s body .

CARDINAL . In his letters of DATE and DATE concerning PERSON , and in his letter of CARDINAL DATE regarding PERSON , the applicant stated that the conditions of detention in those penitentiaries amounted to inhuman and degrading treatment because the CARDINAL prisons were overcrowded and infested with parasites , the food and the general hygiene conditions were poor , he was refused a special diet for his diabetes , and he did not have access to appropriate bathroom or washing facilities .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action against FAC authorities for an injunction allowing him to access his medical file , on the ground that he had received a complete copy of his medical file , from which none of the documents had been missing .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s criminal complaint claiming abuse of power on the part of GPE – one of the prosecutors who had investigated the murder charge against him DATE on the ground that no unlawful act had been committed .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of DATE ORG dismissed , on the basis of documentary , testimonial and medical evidence , the applicant ’s action for ill - treatment against GPE , GPE and GPE , all employees of FAC , on the ground that there was no proof in the file attesting that the applicant had been ill - treated by those individuals .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the order of ORG of DATE refusing to indict the masked guards in PERSON who had allegedly beaten the applicant on DATE , on the ground that it was time - barred .

CARDINAL . By a final judgment of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action to obtain an injunction in order to be heard by a pensions commission . The court held that the applicant had made CARDINAL requests for copies of documents from his prison file which had all been approved by the prison authorities , and that he had been provided with the requested copies . Moreover , the prison authorities had approved the applicant ’s requests to be heard by a pensions commission and to be provided with the relevant information for his pension file . He had been taken twice to the FAC and GPE District CARDINAL ORG and he had been provided with the requested information .

CARDINAL . In the large majority of his letters addressed to the ORG DATE the applicant repeatedly referred to the NORP President , the Members of ORG , the prison guards in all the prisons he was detained in , and the judges and prosecutors who examined and investigated his cases and complaints , as “ communists ” , “ ORG members ” , “ members of the former ORG ( securişti ) ” , “ terrorists , executioners , murderers and accomplices to ill - treatment ” .

CARDINAL . In his letters of CARDINAL May and CARDINAL DATE , as well as on an unspecified date in DATE , the applicant accused members of ORG , some of the judges and ORG being “ ORG members ” , of “ plotting together with the terrorist LOC ” , and of “ being accomplices of members of the former ORG ( securişti ) ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government submitted their observations to the ORG and argued , inter alia , that the language used by the applicant amounted to an abuse of the right of application and that his application should be dismissed .

CARDINAL . In his letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant stated , inter alia , that he believed the ORG had made a “ genocide pact ” with the “ murderers ” who hid behind the name of leaders of a rule - of - law ORG like GPE , because it had failed to examine his case . Moreover , he claimed that members of ORG and certain judges had contributed to his physical and mental torture .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE containing the applicant ’s observations in reply to those of the Government , the applicant stated that the “ brutish ” NORP prison authorities had attempted to lie to the ORG by sending false information about his detention conditions , and he asked the ORG to inform ORG that he was a liar . Moreover , he submitted that :
“ ... by the false documents submitted to ORG ... ORG falsified the actual reality and lied ... ORG is a liar . ”
CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant called the Government Agents “ brutish ” and “ buffoons ” and stated that , together with ORG , they constantly misinformed the ORG .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Government reiterated their request for ORG to dismiss the applicant ’s case as an abuse of the right of application . They stated that the applicant continued to submit inappropriate letters using offensive language and making defamatory allegations concerning the activities of the NORP authorities .
